intro: Polycodium arcuatum, commonly known as the hooked polycodium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant features slender, upright stems that bear alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a rough, textured surface. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters during the spring and summer months. Polycodium arcuatum is typically found in moist, wooded areas and is characterized by its unique hooked seed capsules that aid in seed dispersal.
